intro: Collaea crassifolia var. angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved collaea, is a flowering plant native to southern South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, pale pink to white flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
